criticalFailure: You commit everything to the disarm attempt, swinging wildly at {targetName}'s weapon. They simply pull it back, and your wild swing throws you completely off-balance. You stumble, nearly falling, your own weapon wavering in your grip!

Your overzealous disarm attempt is so poorly executed that you nearly disarm yourself! Your weapon twists in your hand, and you have to scramble to maintain your own grip while {targetName} watches with evident amusement!
You lunge for {targetName}'s weapon with terrible technique. Not only do you miss, but the awkward motion leaves you overextended and vulnerable, your own weapon held out of position!

criticalSuccess: Like a duelist of old, you read {targetName}'s weapon placement perfectly. Your strike comes in with surgical precision, hitting their blade at the exact point where leverage is maximized. The physics are inescapable - their weapon is torn from their grasp with such force it becomes a projectile. It spins through the air in a graceful arc, catching light as it tumbles, before clattering to the ground meters away. {targetName} stares at their empty hand, stunned by the mastery they just witnessed. They are utterly, completely disarmed!

In one explosive motion combining strength, technique, and perfect timing, you execute the textbook-perfect disarm. Your weapon meets theirs with a resonant clang, the vibration traveling up {targetName}'s arm and numbing their fingers. Before they can even think to tighten their grip, their weapon is already flying free. It arcs away through space, end over end, before embedding point-first in the ground several feet distant. {targetName} is left staring at their trembling, empty hand!
success: Your disarm is efficient and effective. A quick strike to {targetName}'s weapon, a twist of leverage, and their grip breaks. The weapon falls from their hand, clattering to the ground at their feet. Not the most spectacular disarm, but perfectly functional.

You knock solidly against {targetName}'s weapon with yours. The impact is enough - their grip loosens and the weapon drops. It lands nearby, still within their reach, but for this moment they're unarmed.
failure: You attempt a textbook disarm, striking at {targetName}'s weapon with proper technique and good timing. But {targetName}'s grip is iron-strong, their stance perfect. Your strike connects but accomplishes nothing - the weapon stays firmly in their hand, unmoved.

Despite flawless form and committed effort, you can't dislodge {targetName}'s weapon. They've anticipated the disarm, adjusted their grip, and your strike simply glances off. Frustrating, but sometimes superior preparation beats superior technique.
criticalFailure: In your zealous attempt to disarm {targetName}, you swing with more enthusiasm than skill. Your strike aimed at their weapon is telegraphed so obviously that they simply move it aside. Your own weapon, finding no resistance where you expected it, continues its arc unchecked. The wild swing spins you around, throwing you completely off-balance. You stumble, your own weapon waving uselessly, and {targetName} has a perfect opening to strike. What should have left them disarmed instead leaves you defenseless!

Your attempted disarm is catastrophically executed. You lunge for {targetName}'s weapon with such poor technique that you nearly lose your own in the process! Your grip fumbles, your weapon twists awkwardly in your hand, and you have to waste precious moments securing your own hold while {targetName} stands there, weapon firmly in hand, clearly wondering what you were thinking!

criticalSuccess: You don't try to match their strength - that would be futile. Instead, you use physics. You target the weapon itself, striking at the perfect point to create maximum leverage. Your blow exploits the weapon's weight and mass, using it against them. With expert timing, you wrench it at an angle their grip simply can't resist. Despite their superior strength, physics wins. The weapon tears from their grasp and flies free!

Like a master using leverage to move the world, you demonstrate perfect technique. You strike their weapon at exactly the right spot, creating a fulcrum point. Their strength, which should be an advantage, actually works against them as the weapon's weight becomes the lever. With a sharp twist, you exploit the mechanics perfectly. Their fingers can't maintain the grip - the weapon is wrenched free!

You read the weapon's balance and their grip with expert precision. Your strike targets the weak point in their hold, the place where leverage overcomes strength. With perfect timing and positioning, you twist the weapon against their grip. Physics does the rest. The massive weapon flies from their hands, leaving them disarmed by pure technique!
success: You employ clever leverage to disarm the larger foe. Using the weapon's own weight and careful positioning instead of matching their strength, you manage to wrench it free. Their grip breaks despite their size advantage, and the weapon falls to the ground.

Your disarm targets the mechanical weak point in their grip. The size disadvantage makes it challenging, but your technique is sound. You exploit leverage effectively enough to break their hold and send the weapon to the ground.
You use leverage-based disarming to overcome the bigger opponent's strength. By striking at the right angle and exploiting the weapon's balance, you successfully knock it from their grasp.

Despite clever positioning and good leverage, you can't overcome their superior grip strength. The larger foe's power keeps the weapon firmly in hand. Your disarm, technically sound, simply lacks the force needed against their might.
You try to use mechanics against their strength, but it doesn't work today. Their grip is too strong, their size too great. Your skilled disarm attempt fails to wrench the weapon free.

When you try to wrench the weapon, their grip doesn't just hold - it's like trying to move something bolted in place. The resistance throws you off-balance, and you stumble badly, nearly dropping your own weapon!

Your technical approach to disarming the larger foe backfires catastrophically. You strike for maximum leverage, but their powerful grip simply doesn't break. The jarring impact of hitting their immovable hold reverberates through your weapon. Your own grip loosens while theirs stays firm!

You attempt to use clever mechanics to overcome their strength, but their size defeats you utterly. Your technique is perfect, but their grip is unbreakable. The failed attempt leaves you overextended and vulnerable, your leverage crushed by raw power!

criticalSuccess: This is where technique transcends strength. You study the larger foe's weapon with calculating precision - reading its balance, its weight distribution, its leverage points. You see not an impossible challenge but exploitable physics. You strike with perfect accuracy, hitting the weapon at the exact point where a small force creates maximum effect. It's all about the fulcrum. Your blow lands with explosive precision, creating a lever arm that multiplies your force exponentially. Their grip, however strong, is positioned wrong to resist this kind of mechanical advantage. For one frozen moment, their fingers strain to maintain hold. Then physics wins. The weapon is torn from their grasp with such force it spins through the air like a thrown javelin. It clatters away meters distant while they stare at their empty hands in shock. You've disarmed a giant through pure technique!

Like an ancient Greek mathematician using levers to move the world, you demonstrate the ultimate triumph of knowledge over strength. You don't try to overpower their grip - that's impossible. Instead, you weaponize physics itself. You identify the precise point on their massive weapon where striking will create maximum leverage. Your blow lands with surgical precision. The weapon's own weight becomes your ally as you twist it at an angle their grip simply cannot resist. The mechanics are inescapable. Their powerful fingers, positioned for strength but not for this kind of torque, simply can't maintain their hold. The weapon is wrenched from their grasp with irresistible force, flying free to land far away. They're bigger, stronger, but you're smarter. And that's made all the difference!
success: You employ solid technique to disarm the larger opponent. Using leverage and proper positioning instead of matching their strength, you strike their weapon at an effective point. It's not easy - their powerful grip resists - but your skill prevails. The weapon breaks free and falls, leaving them temporarily unarmed.

Your disarm uses proper mechanics to overcome the strength disadvantage. You target the weapon's balance point with a well-placed strike, exploiting leverage. The larger foe's grip, however strong, can't resist the physics involved. The weapon falls free.
failure: You move in with sound technique, striking at the leverage point that should let you disarm the larger foe. But today, strength simply triumphs over mechanics. Their grip is too powerful, their hold too firm. Despite perfect positioning and proper technique, the weapon stays locked in their grasp. Your disarm has failed.

Your technical approach is flawless - angle, timing, leverage all correct. But reality proves unkind. The larger foe's sheer strength creates challenges your technique simply can't overcome. You can't generate enough effective force to break their grip. The weapon remains firmly in their hand despite your best efforts.
criticalFailure: You commit to the disarm with complete confidence in your technique. You've studied leverage, understand mechanics, and you're certain you can wrench this weapon free. You're catastrophically wrong. You strike at what you believe is the perfect point, using what you think is the right angle. And achieve... nothing. The larger foe's grip doesn't just resist - it's utterly immovable. Their strength is so overwhelming that your leverage might as well not exist. Worse, the jarring impact of your strike against their unbreakable hold reverberates back through your own weapon. Your fingers go numb from the shock. You nearly lose your own grip while theirs stays iron-firm. What should have left them disarmed instead leaves you fumbling. Strength has defeated skill decisively!

Your attempt to disarm the giant using leverage and technique becomes a masterclass in failure. You position yourself with what you believe is perfect precision, ready to exploit mechanical advantage. But when you execute the disarm, reality intervenes brutally. Their strength is simply too overwhelming. Your strike doesn't just fail to break their grip - the resistance is so solid it jars your entire arm. The shock travels up through your weapon, loosening your own hold while theirs remains firm as stone. You stumble backward, weapon wavering in your numbed fingers, while they stand there completely unaffected, their grip on their weapon unshaken. Your expertise has been utterly overwhelmed by raw power!
